title: What is this font? Almost close to Bodega Sans, but not horseshoes or hand grenades!
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110317im_/http:/typophile.com/files/persimmon-scorecard_6630.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [persimmon-scorecard.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110317/http:/typophile.com/files/persimmon-scorecard.jpg) | 47.32 KB |

 [‹ Wonderland Magazine - Very Fine Moderne](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110317/http:/typophile.com/node/49918 "Go to previous forum topic") [NEWWORK ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110317/http:/typophile.com/node/50280 "Go to next forum topic")
author: rmk

comments.content:
I think PERSIMMON may be a mix of Casablanca Condensed and Triplex Sans Condensed. See them both on this page of the [Bauhaus-style Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110317/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces3.html)

It’s possible COUNTRY CLUB comes from the same ’font’, but that Y is not in either of the two I mentioned.

.- Mike Yanega

[Mighty Tuxedo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110317/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/astigmatic/mighty-tuxedo-aoe/) is a fair match for Persimmon, but still not that Y.

- Mike Yanega

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110317im_/http:/typophile.com/files/persimmon-logo_4236.jpg)
 thanks for your assistance. Those are close, but I went with Bodega Sans and extended it and letterspaced it to mock it up close enough. I know, blasphemy to the true typograher nature, but I got over that a few years ago when I quit priding myself on being able to duplicate logos. I figure if I’d been born in Michelangelo’s time I’d be making a living duplicating works of art instead of creating them. Rick Kirkman
